Description: Dīnār weight (coin). With 4 line Kufic inscription in dotted border. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 2 = Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo, 1; Balog, P. 1976. ‘Ummayad, ʿAbbasid and Ṭūlūnid glass weights and vessel-stamps’. New York, 4.

A second dīnār-weight die of Qurra, has a different legend with mithqāl for mīzān (Miles 1964, 1). For an anonymous 'fals' weight probably to be attributed to about the period of Qurra, see OA+ 4261. Bibliography: Miles, G.C. 1964. Early Islamic weights and measures in the Muntaza Palace, Alexandria. ‘Journal of the American Research Centre in Egypt’ III. Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (2)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Qurra b. Sharīk
